code.text:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from scipy import stats

full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")

x = full_health_data["Average_Pulse"]
y = full_health_data["Calorie_Burnage"]

slope, intercept, r, p, std_err = stats.linregress(x, y)

def myfunc(x):
return slope * x + intercept

mymodel = list(map(myfunc, x))

plt.scatter(x, y)
plt.plot(x, mymodel)
plt.ylim(ymin=0, ymax=2000)
plt.xlim(xmin=0, xmax=200)
plt.xlabel("Average_Pulse")
plt.ylabel ("Calorie_Burnage")
plt.show()

code.text: Slope = f(x2) - f(x1) / x2-x1
code.html: Slope = f(x2) - f(x1) / x2-x1

code.text:
def slope(x1, y1, x2, y2):
s = (y2-y1)/(x2-x1)
return s

print (slope(80,240,90,260))
code.html:
def slope(x1, y1, x2, y2):
  s = (y2-y1)/(x2-x1)
  return s

print (slope(80,240,90,260))

code.text:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

correlation_full_health = full_health_data.corr()

axis_corr = sns.heatmap(
correlation_full_health,
vmin=-1, vmax=1, center=0,
cmap=sns.diverging_palette(50, 500, n=500),
square=True
)

plt.show()

square=True
)

plt.show()

tutorials.title: Data Science - Statistics Correlation vs. Causality

code.text:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

Drowning_Accident = [20,40,60,80,100,120,140,160,180,200]
Ice_Cream_Sale = [20,40,60,80,100,120,140,160,180,200]
Drowning = {"Drowning_Accident": [20,40,60,80,100,120,140,160,180,200],
"Ice_Cream_Sale": [20,40,60,80,100,120,140,160,180,200]}
Drowning = pd.DataFrame(data=Drowning)

Drowning.plot(x="Ice_Cream_Sale", y="Drowning_Accident", kind="scatter")
plt.show()

correlation_beach = Drowning.corr()
print(correlation_beach)
code.html:

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from scipy import stats

full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")

x = full_health_data["Average_Pulse"]
y = full_health_data ["Calorie_Burnage"]

slope, intercept, r, p, std_err = stats.linregress(x, y)

def myfunc(x):
return slope * x + intercept

mymodel = list(map(myfunc, x))

plt.scatter(x, y)
plt.plot(x, slope * x + intercept)
plt.ylim(ymin=0, ymax=2000)
plt.xlim(xmin=0, xmax=200)
plt.xlabel("Average_Pulse")
plt.ylabel ("Calorie_Burnage")
plt.show()

code.text:
import pandas as pd
import statsmodels.formula.api as smf

full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")

model = smf.ols('Calorie_Burnage ~ Average_Pulse', data = full_health_data)
results = model.fit()
print(results.summary())
code.html:
import pandas as pd
import statsmodels.formula.api as smf

full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")

model = smf.ols('Calorie_Burnage ~ Average_Pulse', data = full_health_data)
results = model.fit()
print(results.summary())

code.text: Calorie_Burnage = 0.3296 * Average_Pulse + 346.8662
code.html: Calorie_Burnage = 0.3296 * Average_Pulse + 346.8662

def Predict_Calorie_Burnage(Average_Pulse):
 return(0.3296*Average_Pulse + 346.8662)

print(Predict_Calorie_Burnage(120))
print(Predict_Calorie_Burnage(130))
print(Predict_Calorie_Burnage(150))
print(Predict_Calorie_Burnage(180))

code.text:
H0: Average_Pulse = 0
HA: Average_Pulse ≠ 0
H0: Intercept = 0
HA: Intercept ≠ 0
code.html:
H0: Average_Pulse = 0
HA: Average_Pulse ≠ 0
H0: Intercept = 0
HA: Intercept ≠ 0

code.text:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from scipy import stats

full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")

x = full_health_data["Duration"]
y = full_health_data ["Calorie_Burnage"]

slope, intercept, r, p, std_err = stats.linregress(x, y)

def myfunc(x):
return slope * x + intercept

mymodel = list(map(myfunc, x))

print(mymodel)

plt.scatter(x, y)
plt.plot(x, mymodel)
plt.ylim(ymin=0, ymax=2000)
plt.xlim(xmin=0, xmax=200)
plt.xlabel("Duration")
plt.ylabel ("Calorie_Burnage")

plt.show()

code.text:
import pandas as pd
import statsmodels.formula.api as smf

full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")

model = smf.ols('Calorie_Burnage ~ Average_Pulse + Duration', data = full_health_data)
results = model.fit()
print(results.summary())
code.html:
import pandas as pd
import statsmodels.formula.api as smf

full_health_data = pd.read_csv("data.csv", header=0, sep=",")

model = smf.ols('Calorie_Burnage ~ Average_Pulse + Duration', data = full_health_data)
results = model.fit()
print(results.summary())

code.text: Calorie_Burnage = Average_Pulse * 3.1695 + Duration * 5.8424 - 334.5194
code.html: Calorie_Burnage = Average_Pulse * 3.1695 + Duration * 5.8424 - 334.5194

code.text: Calorie_Burnage = Average_Pulse * 3.17 + Duration * 5.84 - 334.52
code.html: Calorie_Burnage = Average_Pulse * 3.17 + Duration * 5.84 - 334.52

def Predict_Calorie_Burnage(Average_Pulse, Duration):
 return(3.1695*Average_Pulse + 5.8434 * Duration - 334.5194)

print(Predict_Calorie_Burnage(110,60))
print(Predict_Calorie_Burnage(140,45))
print(Predict_Calorie_Burnage(175,20))
